page.title: 13A CHURCHILL PERSONALITY
page.content: 1984/5 saw Oxfordshire's first woman High Sheriff, Miss Judy Hutchinson of Sarsden Glebe, Churchill. Her year of office was used to find out how public servants served the community. She visited hospitals, children's and old people's homes, fire and ambulance stations, law courts, prisons and detention centres. Prizes were presented at local schools, and she spoke at many clubs and institutes about her year in office, and stressed how pleased she was to have the opportunity to see all the hard work people did in the community. She gave parties and garden parties at the Glebe, for local voluntary workers and one for the Riding for Disabled, and British Red Cross, of which she is a hard-working member. Miss Hutchinson has lived here since she was a child, and has a wide variety of activities.
